articles.title: Cancer Cells Engineered To Self-Destruct by Producing Bacterial Toxin - Technology Networks
articles.description: Researchers encoded a toxin produced by bacteria into mRNA molecules and delivered these particles directly to cancer cells, causing the cells to produce the toxin – which eventually killed them with a success rate of 50%.
